results.title: The City Speaks
results.creator_credit: Housing Commission of Victoria and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Made in 1965 showing the provision of housing for Melbourne’s growing population, 50,000 of whom live in 1,000 acres of inner suburban slums. Following demolition, large block of flats provide the amenities and home comforts for low income families at low rentals where children can play happily in well planned playgrounds. The historic footage of the demolition of inner city dwellings to accommodate high rise housing commission flats and the intentions behind the move are interesting to view in retrospect.

results.title: Choosing Your Marriage Partner
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of a young man who is trying to decide which of two young women would make the better wife!?! Several important factors in selecting a marriage partner are illustrated; emotional maturity, family background, harmony of personality, philosophy of life and common interests. Note: Made in 1952.

results.title: Public hangings. Series 1. Ep. 04
results.brief_description: Public hangings is a local television program on the arts produced for and broadcast on community television (channel 31) in Melbourne, Australia from 2002. Enjoying a cult following, the program produced by Irish art critic and London gallery director, Andrew Mackenzie, roams the streets of Melbourne in search of opening nights and visual vox pops. The program’s style makes the avant-garde accessible and provides an insight into a vibrant underground city culture. In this episode Andrew takes us to the RMIT Gallery where an exhibition by political/journalist cartoonists is taking place. This is then followed by a visit to The Photographers’ Gallery; the Penthouse and Pavement “Graveyard Boys and Cemetery Girls” Exhibition (horror culture); Gertrude Street Galleries “Angled 2002” Exhibition by Natasha Johns-Messenger; West Space “Suburban myth” Exhibition and finally an interview with video artist Robin Hely.

results.title: Living with happiness
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt and Sarah Watt Productions
results.brief_description: A young mother finds herself gripped by an overwhelming pessimism that threatens to consume her. Only a freak accident on a lonely beach may be the key to her future happiness. Voices performed by Sigrid Thornton and William McInnes. (Awards: Winner, Emirates AFI Award for Best Animation, 2001)

results.title: [Kodak Cinegraph compilation. No. 05]
results.brief_description: A compilation of silent newsreels including: 1. Coronation of (probably) King George V. 2. The tribute of the forest - The ‘Hoop Pine’ of Queensland used for making matches and butter boxes. An example of the “winch and steel cable” method (?) - logging in Queensland. Bullock teams also shown hauling logs. 3. Burton Holmes’ Film Reels of Travel - alpine vistas. 4. Alfred Weiss presents ‘Another kick coming’. 5. Sheep dipping and general farm scenes. 6. Granite Quarry in action. 7. Steel production.

results.title: Hotham holiday
results.brief_description: Shows Mount Hotham, Victoria as a holiday getaway - the snow fields, ski-runs; the trip from Harrietville 12 miles away; people riding horses to reach the snowline; beautiful views and natural environment. Hotham Heights is the highest meteorological station in Australia. This film was made pre “chairlifts”.

results.title: Bali II: paradise isle
results.brief_description: Bali II described as a “gem of the Dutch East Indies”. This travelogue concentrates on the traditions of Bali - its agriculture and markets, and cultural practices.

results.title: Wildflower Wonderland
results.brief_description: Informational travelogue on the Grampians National Park focussing mainly on the diversity of flora in and around the area and interspersed with scenes of people bushwalking some of the well-known tracks available.
